column5: FYI Across Northwestern Ontario Fire hazards are high to extreme across the northwest. Effective at midnight Wednesday, September 6, until further notice all open burning, including campfires, is banned. These restrictions apply to the Ministry of Natural Resources districts of Dryden, Fort Frances, Kenora, Nipigon, Red Lake, Sioux Lookout and Thunder Bay. Please contact your local ministry office to see if your area is affected bit of a long link, but has map etc. includes everything around LOW, Lac Suel, etc. Probably can get to this by shortening the link Vhttp://affm.mnr.gov.on.ca/spectrasit...21C4FD0353783E
Thanks for the post. We're headed up tomorrow so I'll take my Coleman stove along. It's not quite the same but it works.
Fire ban is still on, but calling for rain all weekend in the Red Lake areas.
Fire ban has been lifted in the Red Lake area as of 10:30 a.m. Tuesday September 19th.
We're going to Lac Seul on the 29th. Are propane stoves O.K. for shore lunch during a ban? Sure hope so, not the same but still nice to have fresh fish for lunch. Mark
It is my understanding the restriction was lifted onWednesday, do be careful, the bush, although is still fairly dry below the wet surface
the fire ban has been lifted as of last friday. just returned from lac seul

Just came back Saturday from English River. True that fire ban is lifted for now. Weather remains much cooler and wetter that previous month, so hopefully ban is over for the season, but check every so often to be sure V
